title.rendered: Minecraft: Price increase – PC version is more expensive

content.rendered:
Minecraft is becoming more expensive in some regions: Many European and thus also German players will have to pay a few euros more for the popular building block sandbox from Mojang and Microsoft from next week. Instead of the previous 19.95 euros, 23.95 euros will be due from Monday, May 23, 2016. However, this only applies to the PC version of the game. The versions for consoles and mobile devices, however, remain unchanged in price.

The makers want to take action against the fluctuating exchange rate and adjust global prices to the US dollar, according to the corresponding statement from Mojang. Those responsible also published a list of price changes in different regions on the official website of the developer studio – not all countries are affected. If you are currently considering purchasing Minecraft, now is a good time. More about the game on our topic page.
